summary: Discussing concurrent design and self-hosted DNS, considering using a low-privilege user or even root, encountered issues on x64, tried executing "/bin/bash", killed by SIGSYS, exploring whether to do without judger's help.

details.comment: Discussing concurrent design and self-hosted DNS, considering using a low-privilege user or even root, encountered issues on x64, tried executing "/bin/bash", killed by SIGSYS, exploring whether to do without judger's help.
details.content:
concurrent design.
Self-hosting DNS. Or something else.
prepare a low-priviliege user, or just use default one or even root?
on x64 it was hell.
[pid  8411] execve("/bin/bash", ["/bin/bash"], 0x7ffc4fd079d0 /* 0 vars */) = ?
[pid  8411] +++ killed by SIGSYS +++	
can we do this without the help of judger? for example, do our own work.
